name: Node Overcommitment
description: The PromQL query measures the degree of overcommitment of resources on a node, indicating the extent to which more resources have been allocated to containers or pods than are physically available on the node.
question: What is the total CPU usage on the node?

description: The PromQL query measures the degree of overcommitment of resources on a node, indicating the extent to which more resources have been allocated to containers or pods than are physically available on the node.
question: How much CPU time has been consumed by all processes on the node?

name: Cluster Residual Capacity
description: The PromQL query measures the remaining capacity or available resources within a cluster, indicating how much more workload the cluster can handle before reaching its limit.
question: What is the current residual capacity of the cluster in terms of CPU usage?

description: The PromQL query measures the remaining capacity or available resources within a cluster, indicating how much more workload the cluster can handle before reaching its limit.
